description.value:
‘What doesn’t kill you makes you stronger’ is normally a joke for adventurers. Patchwork Blades are those who take it to the extreme. These bestial warriors take on the strength of the creatures they hunt, growing in monstrous power with every victory. As consummate hunters, Patchwork Blades study their prey, making use of their weaknesses. When you fight the ultimate hunters, it takes one to know one. Some Blades believe that they receive strength from the gods with every kill. Others take a more direct route, and physically alter their own forms using the magical blood or remnants of their prey. Regardless, all are a fearsome sight, and stray further and further from mortality with each notch in the axe.

Patchwork Blades can be flavored in different ways, and can be found in a variety of places within Eberron as a result. The greatest number form part of the Wyrd Vigil of Vralkast, taking on the horrors of Khyber and warping themselves to defend their city. The disciples of the daelkyr Dyrrn the Corruptor might also travel such a path, taking the body parts of their prey to further their own evolution. Some changelings, especially the doppelgangers of Lost, take the opposite approach - they study and mimic the forms of others to master their shapechanging techniques. Those Patchwork Blades who take on the spiritual strength of their prey tend to belong to druidic communities, as well as Stormreach’s Lords of the Hunt. The goliaths of the Blood of Kanda see The Hunt to be a religious ritual, and take on the aspects of the dragons and leviathans of the Dark Sea that they slay in their duties.
